column7: Washington’s Teeth Weren’t Wooden
Adams Used To Skip School
Thomas Jefferson Founded The University Of Virginia
Madison Was Princeton’s First Grad Student
The Capital Of Liberia Was Named After Monroe
John Quincy Adams Regularly Skinny-Dipped In The Potomac
Andrew Jackson Taught His Parrot To Curse
Martin Van Buren Popularized The Phrase “OK”
William Henry Harrison Had A Pet Goat
John Tyler Was An Awesome Violinist
James Polk Promised Not To Seek A Second Term If Elected
Taylor Had A Really Cool Nickname “Old Rough And Ready”
Millard Fillmore Married His Teacher
Franklin Pierce Didn’t Swear His Oath Of Office
Buchanan Was A Bachelor
Lincoln Was A Great Wrestler
Andrew Johnson Was Drunk During His Inauguration
Ulysses S. Grant Got A Speeding Ticket On A Horse
Hayes Banned Alcohol From The White House
Not only was he the first president to be both righty and lefty but it was said he could write a sentence in Latin with one hand and write it in Greek with the other hand.
Arthur practically sold anything in the White House that wasn’t nailed down (24 wagon loads worth of stuff) to raise money for new furniture.
Grover Cleveland Was Legal Guardian To The Girl He Later Married
Benjamin Harrison was the sitting president when electricity was first installed in the White House. He was scared of being electrocuted and refused to touch the light switches.
Grover Cleveland Had An Artificial Jaw
William McKinley was the first presidential candidate to campaign using the telephone.
In his early childhood Teddy Roosevelt suffered from very severe asthma. He began to regularly exercise in order to combat the illness.
William Taft became the only ex-president to serve as Chief Justice of the Supreme Court - effectively becoming the only person to serve as the head of two branches of government
Wilson was the only president to hold a doctorate degree - making him the highest educated president in the history of the United States
Harding liked to gamble - in one poker game he bet the White House china collection and lost it all in one hand.
Calvin Coolidge had a morning ritual in which someone rubbed Vaseline on his head while he ate breakfast in bed
Hoover and his wife learned to speak Mandarin Chinese fluently. They would speak the language around the White House to prevent others from understanding them.
FDR Has A Movie Credit for a mystery novel premise that he made up during a dinner party.
Truman Was A Failed Haberdasher
Eisenhower Almost Had His Leg Amputated.
John F. Kennedy's application to study at Harvard was fairly unimpressive by today's standards
President Johnson was famous among White House staffers for having no shame about asking people to follow him into the bathroom to continue conversations as he relieved himself.
Nixon Was A Card Shark
Gerald And Betty Ford Were Fashion Models
Carter Was A Peanut Farmer
At one point Ronald Reagan's acting career was going so badly that he took a gig as a Las Vegas stand-up comic for a few weeks.
George H.W. Bush was the captain of both the varsity baseball and soccer teams and he played as a forward on the school's basketball team.
Bill Clinton Is A Two-Time Grammy Winner
George W. Bush played baseball and was a cheerleader in high school.
Barack Obama Was A Comic Book Nerd
Trump has never smoked cigarettes drank alcohol or done drugs.
